result.execSummary:
The defendant Demetrius Dwayne Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felony Murder-Armed Robbery, an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.03.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges.
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid as condition of Extended Supevision,  by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain GED.  Vocational training.  Seek and maintain employment.
Mental health assessment, treatment or program.
No violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  
Court advised defendant he cannot possess firearms or body armor; he must provide a DNA sample, pay the mandatory surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Demetrius Dwayne Taylor

records.addlTxt:
per remittitur dated April 6, 2020, Appeal No. 2017AP000177 CRNM, IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on February 4, 2020, that:
IT IS ORDERED that the judgment of conviction is summarily affirmed. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.21.  
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Steven Zaleski is relieved of further representation of Demetrius Dwayne Taylor in this matter. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.32(3).
records.descr: Remittitur/Court of Appeals dec & order affirming

records.addlTxt: Per order dated january 4, 2020, Appeal No. 2017AP177-CRNM, IT IS ORDERED that the judgment of conviction is summarily affirmed.  See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.21.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Steven Zaleski is relieved of further representation of Demetrius Dwayne Taylor in this matter.  see WIS. STAT. RULE 809.32(3).  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED  that this summary disposition order will not be published.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Demetrius Dwayne Taylor in court with attorney Scott F. Anderson.  Defendant Demetrius Dwayne Taylor in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by counsel, Aquilla R., Theresa B. and defendant. COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms or body armor, he must provide a DNA sample, pay the mandatory DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 32 years with 389 days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 25 years  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 7 years; pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection; pay restitution of $7,417.17 to Aquilla R. by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution; 3) obtain GED; 4) vocational training; 5) mental health assessment, treatment or program; 6) seek and maintain employment.

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis;
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Attorney Scott F. Anderson in court, defendant Demetrius Dwayne Taylor not in court, in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Court is continuing with a jury trial and unable to proceed to sentencing today on this case.  Court adjourns sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Crime Victim Impact Statement received and filed./ds

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 646
cf

See case no. 14cf3934 for request for payment of witness fees prepared by the DA's Victim/Witness Services dated 3/26/15 for Shavonda B., Michael S. for 2 appearances each on 12/16/14, 3/16/15;Wesley C. c/o Warren C.; Harry W. for 2 appearances each on 12/17/14, 3/17/15; Wynne C. for 3 appearances on 12/17/14, 3/17/15, 3/18/15.

Defendant Demetrius Dwayne Taylor in court with attorney Scott F. Anderson.  Defendant Demetrius Dwayne Taylor in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

At the hour of 10:37 a.m., the jury returned and by their foreperson returned a verdict as follows:

"We, the Jury, find the defendant, Demetrius Taylor, guilty of Felony Murder in manner and form as charged in the Information.  Dated at Milwaukee, Wisconsin, this 19th day of March, 2015."

Court polls the jury.  State moves for judgment on the verdict.  Defense moves for judgment notwithstanding the verdict.  Court grants State motion and orders a judgment of conviction be entered on the record.

Court orders defendant REMANDED into the custody of the sheriff.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by the counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and the defendant.   Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 48 hours in advance of the sentencing.  Any issues of restitution will be addressed at sentencing.  Case set for sentencing on 4-10-15 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 44.

Case recalled.  Same appearances.

Jury in the box at 1:34 p.m.  Sworn-in for the defense:  Milwaukee Police Detective Patrick Pajot; Milwaukee Police Detective Jeremiah Jacks.  Defense rests.  Jury out of the box at 1:47 p.m.  Court advises the defendant on his right to testify.  Court finds the defendant freely and voluntarily waives his right to testify.  Jury in the box at 2:07 p.m.  Court instructs the jury.  Closing arguments by counsel.  Court charges the jury.  Alternate juror is chosen.  At the hour of 3:28 p.m., the jury retired to deliberate under the charge of Deputy Sheriffs Chris Leranth and Vu Do who were duly sworn for that purpose.  Jury in the box at 4:40 p.m.  Court adjourns case to 3-19-15 at 8:30 a.m.  Jury out of the box at 4:44 p.m.

Defendant Demetrius Dwayne Taylor in court with attorney Scott F. Anderson.  Defendant Demetrius Dwayne Taylor in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Jury in the box at 9:05 a.m.  Sworn-in for the State:  Michael B.; Exhibit #51 marked, identified; Exhibits #12, 13 offered into evidence; denied at this time; Exhibits #12, 13 offered and received into evidence.  Jury out of the box at 10:42 a.m.  Jury in the box at 11:00 a.m.  Sworn-in for the State:  Wynne C.; Exhibit #1 offered and received into evidence; Dr. Wieslawa Tlomak; Exhibit #52, 53, 54, 55 marked, identified; Exhibits #33, 34, 35, 36, 37, 38, 39, 40, 50, 48, 51, 52, 53, 54, 55 offered and received into evidence.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of the box at 11:49 a.m.  Defense moves to dismiss without argument.  Court denies motion.

Case recalled.  Same appearances.

Jury in the box at 1:37 p.m.  Sworn-in for the State:  Milwaukee Police Detective Mark Peterson; Exhibit #49 marked, identified; Milwaukee Police Detective Matthew Bell; Exhibit #49 offered and received into evidence; Exhibit #50 marked, identified; Harry W.; W.C. (DOB: 3-3-99).  Jury out of the box at 3:16 p.m.  Jury in the box at 3:42 p.m.  Testimony of W.C. (DOB: 3-3-99) continues.  Court adjourns case to 8:45 a.m. 3-18-15.  Jury out of the box at 4:30 p.m.

Defendant Demetrius Dwayne Taylor in court with attorney Scott F. Anderson.  Defendant Demetrius Dwayne Taylor in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Jury in the box at 8:45 a.m.  Testimony of Jonathan Jenkins continues; Exhibits #9, 16 offered and received into evidence; Milwaukee Police Detective Jeremiah Jacks; Exhibits # 18, 31, 4, 5, 8, 10, 24, 28 offered and received into evidence; Exhibits #33, 34, 35, 36, 37, 38, 39, 40 marked, identified; Exhibit #41 marked, identified, offered and received into evidence.  Jury out of the box at 10:13 a.m.  Jury in the box at 10:34 a.m.  Sworn-in for the State:  Police Service Specialist Investigator Michael Braunreiter; Exhibit #42 marked, identified; Mark Simonson; Exhibit #43 marked, identified,  offered and received into evidence; Milwaukee Police Detective Michael Walisiewicz; Exhibit #44, 45, 46 marked, identified, offered and received into evidence; Exhibit #42 offered and received into evidence; Milwaukee Police Detective Patrick Pajot; Exhibit #47 marked, identified, offered and received into evidence; Margaret Cairo; Exhibit #48 marked, identified.  Jury out of the box at 11:56 a.m.

Case recalled.  Same appearances. 

Jury in the box at 1:54 p.m.  Voire Dire continues.  Jury out of the box at 2:01 p.m.  Jury in the box at 2:06 p.m.  Voire Dire continues.  Jury list received, filed and sealed.  Jury out of the box at 2:40 p.m.  Jury in the box 2:56 p.m.  Jury sworn-in.  Court gives the jury preliminary instructions.  Opening instructions by counsel.  Sworn-in for the State: Aquilla R.; Exhibit #1 marked, identified; Shavonda B.; Michael S.  Jury out of the box at 4:01 p.m.  Juror states she knows one of the witnesses.  Juror was questioned as to the situation.  Jury in the box at 4:23 p.m.  Sworn-in for the State: Milwaukee Police Officer James Sommer; Forensic Investigator Jonathan Jenkins; Exhibits #2 through 32 marked, identified.  Jury out of the box at 5:00 p.m.

Defendant Demetrius Dwayne Taylor in court with attorney Scott F. Anderson.  Defendant Demetrius Dwayne Taylor in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Parties are prepared to proceed to jury trial.  Parties impanel a jury of 13 good and lawful citizens of Milwaukee County.  Voire Dire: 11:12 a.m.  Court releases the jury for lunch.  Jury out of the box at 11:58 a.m.

Defendant Demetrius Dwayne Taylor in court with attorney Scott F. Anderson.  Defendant Demetrius Dwayne Taylor in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Final pretrial held in chambers.   Parties stipulate to defendant's and witnesses' prior record.   Court rules on Motions in Limine.   Defendant has rejected all offers by the State.  Case remains set for jury trial.
Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions received and filed./ds
Defendant's Witness List received and filed./ds

Attorney Scott F. Anderson in court, defendant Demetrius Dwayne Taylor not in court, in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds
  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Demetrius Dwayne Taylor in court with attorney Scott F. Anderson.  Defendant Demetrius Dwayne Taylor in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Hearing on motion to adjourn jury trial proceeds.  Attorney Anderson will be in jury trial in Br. 10 starting today.   Defense needs to obtain transcripts from codefendant's jury trial.  State does not object.  Court adjourns case.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
DEFENDANT'S NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION TO ADJOURN TRIAL

Attorney Scott F. Anderson in court, defendant Demetrius Dwayne Taylor not in court, in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Pretrial scheduling order received and filed.  Attorney Anderson has a jury trial set in Br. 10 on 1-5-15.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 6, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Scott F. Anderson in court, defendant Demetrius Dwayne Taylor not in court, in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense has not received discovery yet.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Demetrius Dwayne Taylor not in court, defendant in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Public defender's office has not appointed counsel as of today.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel.  Status conference scheduled for October 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Demetrius Dwayne Taylor in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Defendant Demetrius Dwayne Taylor in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant wishes to have new counsel.  Court advises the defendant he is allowed two appointments by the Public Defender's Office.  If motion is granted, this will be his second and final appointment.  Defendant states he understands.  Court grants motion and allows Attorney Mitchell to withdraw as counsel of record subject to public defender's office appointing new counsel.  Court orders jury trial canceled.  Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defense Witness List received and filed./ds
Court is in jury trial.  Case reset to 10-14-14 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 44.  ADA Lewis and Atty. Dan Mitchell notified./ds

State's Witness List, Criminal Convictions Disclosure, State's Notice of Intent to Introduce DNA Evidence & Expert Witness Testimony at Trial, State's Motions in Limine, State's Requested Jury Instructions and Jury Instructions received and filed./ds
Notice of Motion to Join Pursuant to Wis. Stat. 971.12(1) & (4) and State's Motion to Join Purusant to Wis. Stat. 971.12(4) and for Two Jury Panels at the Joined Trial received and filed./ds
Per Attorney Mitchell there are no defense motions.  Parties need not appear.  Case is removed from court's calendar./ds

Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell in court, defendant Demetrius Dwayne Taylor not in court, in custody.  Nicole J. Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Defense request a trial date.  Parties advised as of August 1, 2014 this matter will be reassigned to Judge Konkol, Br 44 in room 506 of the Safety Building.   Case set for final pretrial on 10/10/2014 at 8:30 am.  Jury trial set for 10/20/2014 at 9:00 am.  Scheduling order signed and filed.  All motions to be filed within 30 DAYS.   Case is adjourned to Br. 44.  Motion hearing scheduled for 08-18-2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Demetrius Dwayne Taylor in court with attorney Daniel G Mitchell.  Defendant Demetrius Dwayne Taylor in custody.  Nicole J Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Mark Peterson-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Demetrius Dwayne Taylor in court with attorney Daniel G Mitchell.  Defendant Demetrius Dwayne Taylor in custody.  Nicole J Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for competency hearing.  Sworn for the state: Dr. John Pankiewicz.  Parties stipulate to the doctors qualifications.  Exhibit one is received.  The Court finds that the defendant is competent to proceed, and accepts Dr. Pankiewicz's findings.  The court orders the remand terminated and bail reinstated.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Daniel G Mitchell in court via telephone, defendant Demetrius Dwayne Taylor not in court, in custody.  Nicole J Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Br 10 was going to hear this matter for Br 12.  Defense counsel contacted the court and indicated he is out ill and not able to appear.  Court ordered the matter rescheduled.  Forensic Unit notified.   Case is adjourned to Br 12.  Competency hearing scheduled for 06-05-2014 at 08:30 am.

Br 12 is in trial.  Br 10 will hear this matter for Br 12.  Parties notified.     Case is adjourned to Br 10 for competency hearing on 5/21/2014 at 1:30 p.m. 
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.

Defendant Demetrius Dwayne Taylor in court with attorney Daniel G Mitchell.  Defendant Demetrius Dwayne Taylor in custody.  Nicole J Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
  Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties reviewed report.  Defense has reviewed the report with the defendant, but the defendant appears to not understand the report.  State does not contest findings. Court ordered a hearing as to this matter.    Case is adjourned to Br 12.  Competency hearing scheduled for 05-21-2014 at 01:30 pm.
Doctor's report received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk kmh.

Defendant Demetrius Dwayne Taylor in court with attorney Daniel G Mitchell.  Defendant Demetrius Dwayne Taylor in custody.  Nicole J Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause, suspended proceedings and ordered defendant examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12 due to a co-defendant with a lower pending case.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Demetrius Dwayne Taylor

Prior: 2009 N. 38th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53208
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Demetrius Dwayne Taylor in court with attorney Bridget J Krause.  Defendant Demetrius Dwayne Taylor in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DUGAN, Branch 10.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
